casebody.data:
Carl BOSTIC, Appellant, v. UNITED STATES of America, Appellee. No. 7654. Circuit Court of Appeals, Sixth Circuit. March 4, 1937. W. B. Bartels, of Columbus, Ohio, for appellant. Francis C. Canny, of Cincinnati, Ohio, for the United States.

Before MOORMAN, HICKS, and SIMONS, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

It appearing to the court that the appeal in this cause has been abandoned, it is ordered that the appeal be, and the same is, docketed and dismissed, the costs to be charged against the government as constructive earnings.
